Name: Requiring the department of environmental protection to establish a program to provide financial assistance for the purchase and installation of backwater valves.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of environmental protection to establish a program to provide financial assistance for the purchase and installation of backwater valves

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Resiliency and Waterfronts

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Environmental Protection to establish a program that would provide financial assistance to reduce the cost of purchasing and installing backwater valves.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
 
      
      Section 1. Chapter 5 of title 24 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 24-532 to read as follows: 
      � 24-532 Backwater valves. Subject to appropriation, the commissioner shall establish a program to provide financial assistance that would reduce the cost of purchasing and installing a backwater valve, as such term is defined in section 202 of the New York city plumbing code.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.






Session 12
